snippet: An execution by an untested combination of a sedative and a paralyzing agent failed and became a scene of cruel and unusual punishment.
abstract: Editorial decries botched execution of convicted murderer Clayton Lockett in Oklahoma, saying painful episode meets the very definition of cruel and unusual punishment; argues Gov Mary Fallin is culpable for ignoring warnings about untested drug cocktail by state's Supreme Court, and urges her to ban all executions in state; cites case as evidence that there is no reliable and human method of execution.
lead_paragraph: An execution by an untested combination of a sedative and a paralyzing agent failed and became a scene of cruel and unusual punishment.
